result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon R Marzicola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs, including Court-appointed attorney fees. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. Restitution may be reduced within 30 days based upon recovered property. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with victims.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Write minimum 250 word apology to victims under DOC's supervision.

timeConds.notes: 30 days are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 30 days to report. Can be served in any county. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

Door County Restitution Summary

Defense waives reading of Information, advises that Defendant is prepared to enter plea. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defense advises Court of State's agreement not to charge bail jumping for missed court appearances. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant about whether he wants to resolve case today. Defendant is willing to proceed. Defense advises that case isn't even to prelim stage, advises of discussions with State/Defendant, is comfortable proceeding with plea today. Court questions Defendant about willingness to proceed today, reviews offer. Defendant wants to proceed. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
No contact direct or indirect with CD and DD or their residence.
Status conference at 07-06-2015 10:00 am
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola appeared by video conference. Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, cash bond that was to be posted, issuance of warrant. Court questions Defendant, who lost job, lost car, visited his sister, works at Quizno's now, lives with his sister, turned his life around. State advises of Calument County case that has had multiple warrants issued, requests $3000 cash bond. Defense requests lower cash or signature bond. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of contact with Defendant, could have $300 and be here by the 1st. State requests stay on bench warrant be lifted, presents argument. State will give Defendant until 3:00 on Wednesday to get $300 here. If not, warrant will be signed.

Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of conversation with Defendant, who does not have transportation, lost job at Grand Central Station, car was impounded, starts new job on Monday with Watry, requests adjournment, addresses cash bond that was supposed to be posted today, requests status on Monday. State requests bench warrant, addresses cash bond that has not been posted. Court orders warrant, stays issuance until Monday at 2:00. Defendant is to appear at that time with $300 cash bond.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/27/15.
Court appoints Brian Van Ells, will address repayment at next hearing.

Defendant in custody.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Discussion regarding Court-appointed Counsel. Court appoints Brian Van Ells, will enter repayment at next court date. Bond set. Atty Van Ells accepts appointment, requests signature bond. State presents argument. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
